articleContent:
Reading Time:  2 minutesThe County of San Diego’s Labor Standards and Enforcement is holding its third annual César Chávez Week of Action from March 25-29.
This weeklong series honors labor rights activist César Chávez by educating workers, employers and community members about labor rights and fair workplace practices. The theme of this year’s week of action is “Building Stronger Workplaces Together.”
The series is a collaborative effort between the County and the Employee Rights Center to:

Advocate for fair labor standards.
Bridge gaps between workers, employers, and community resources.
Inspire action and collaboration for healthier and more just workplaces.
Acknowledge businesses and individuals committed to upholding equitable employment practices.

César Chávez Week of Action Events
Fair Chance Workshop and Job Fair 

March 25, 10 a.m. – 4 p.m., Southeastern Live Well Center, 5101 Market St., San Diego, CA 92114.
Learn about your rights during the Fair Chance Hiring Workshop (10 a.m. – 2 p.m.).
Meet employers and participate in on-site job interviews (1p.m – 4 p.m.).
RSVP here.

Community Breakfast: Honoring Our Workforce 

March 26, 9 a.m. – 11:30 a.m., Employee Rights Center, 4161 Home Ave., San Diego, CA 92105.
Public officials and community advocates will honor local workers and their families over a complimentary breakfast and community connection.
To RSVP, call 619-521-1372.

Virtual Small Business Compliance Workshop 

March 27, 9 a.m.– 11:30 a.m. (Virtual).
Shaw Law Group will teach employers ten ways to stay out of court and answer questions about labor standards.
RSVP here.

High Road Employer Recognition

March 27.
Throughout the day, OLSE will spotlight businesses from each County Supervisorial District who take the “high road to profitability” by going above and beyond for their workers.
Follow along on Facebook, Instagram or LinkedIn.

Vista Business District Walk 

March 28, 10 a.m. – noon.
OLSE and local partners will visit businesses throughout Vista to share resources and answer employers’ questions about labor standards and best practices. ​
For more information, email michael.knab@sdcounty.ca.gov.

Health and Resource Clinic 

March 29, 9 a.m. – 2 p.m., Employee Rights Center, 4161 Home Ave., San Diego, CA 92105.
Attendees can receive legal information, immigration support, workers’ rights training, pet microchipping and more.​

Employers and workers who want more information about workers’ rights or wage theft can contact Labor Standards and Enforcement at olse@sdcounty.ca.gov or 619-531-5129.
For more information about the Week of Action events, email stephanie.hernandez@sdcounty.ca.gov
